stem: A 24-year-old client on an involuntary psychiatric hold (72-hour) is found unconscious after an apparent overdose. Based on the documentation, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Emergency life-saving treatment required for an unconscious client.
Background: Client admitted for suicidal ideation. Involuntary hold in place.
Assessment: Client is GCS 5, apneic, and requires intubation/ventilation.
Recommendation: Stabilization under the doctrine of implied consent.

tabs.title: Legal Hold & Capacity Log
tabs.content:
DocumentStatusNotes
Involuntary HoldActive (Day 2)Suicidal threat
Medical Power of AttorneyNot on fileContacting next of kin
Capacity AssessmentIncapacitatedCurrently unconscious

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 72/40, HR 38, RR 4, SpO2 72%. Client is cyanotic.

actionOptions.text: Document the situation as an exception to informed consent
Delay intubation until a court order is obtained

parameterOptions.text: Glasgow Coma Scale and respiratory stability
Presence of a signed living will
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose

rationale.correct: This is a Medical Emergency (c1). Even if a client is on a psychiatric hold, the 'Doctrine of Implied Consent' applies when the client is incapacitated and their life/health is in immediate danger. The nurse should proceed with emergency care (intubation/ventilation) (a1) and document the clinical necessity (a2). Parameter monitoring focuses on the medical stability (p1) and standard legal attempts to reach surrogates (p2).
clinicalPearls: Implied Consent assumes that a reasonable person would want life-saving help if they were able to ask for it.
An involuntary psychiatric hold does NOT give the hospital the right to perform ELECTIVE surgery, but it does not prevent EMERGENCY medical care.
Always document the 'Who, What, and Why' when acting without a signed consent form.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking a psychiatric patient's involuntary status prevents any medical care without a judge.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Life-safety ALWAYS trumps administrative paperwork in an emergency. If they are dying and cannot speak, fix the medical problem first.
